Paper.Title: Improving Machine Translation Performance by Exploiting Non-Parallel Corpora

Section.S: We present a novel method for discovering parallel sentences in comparable, non-parallel corpora.We train a maximum entropy classifier that, given a pair of sentences, can reliably determinewhether or not they are translations of each other. Using this approach, we extract parallel datafrom large Chinese, Arabic, and English non-parallel newspaper corpora. We evaluate the qualityof the extracted data by showing that it improves the performance of a state-of-the-art statisticalmachine translation system. We also show that a good-quality MT system can be built fromscratch by starting with a very small parallel corpus (100,000 words) and exploiting a largenon-parallel corpus. Thus, our method can be applied with great benefit to language pairs forwhich only scarce resources are available.
